text: Bagalkot is a city in the northern part of Karnataka, India. It is the main city of Bagalkot district. The city is located near the Ghataprabha River and has a dry climate. Bagalkot is connected by roads and trains to other big cities, making it easy to travel to and from. Bagalkot is known for its old temples and historical places. Nearby famous sites are the Badami cave temples and Pattadakal, which is a World Heritage Site. Many people in Bagalkot work in farming, growing crops like sugarcane, cotton and pulses. The city is also growing in industries like textiles and manufacturing. ==Reference== Category:Towns in Karnataka
